summary: Adds some incentives to sleep more often. Also allows werewolves to gain the benefits of sleep via a perk in the Dawnguard Werewolf perk tree.
descriptionHtml:
This mod adds some more incentives to hit the sack and catch up on some lost sleep. You get better benefits from better grades of sleep, so you can catch a light nap in the woods just to keep up and then sleep soundly in the embrace of your loved one when you get home. In addition, by sleeping often, you can extend your Well Rested state for up to two days, even if you sleep outside. More details [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/557639-better-sleep/page__view__findpost__p__4877223]here.[/url]

This mod does NOT change the bonus gained from the Lover\'s Stone. Like in vanilla Skyrim, accepting the Lover\'s Stone bonus will prevent you from receiving the skill XP boosts from sleep, but all other bonuses will be conferred.

In addition to a faster comprehension of the nuances of their trade, a rested Dovahkiin boasts slightly better recovery from wounds, less magic wastage with spells, less fatigue from those big swings, and more strength for carrying around their knickknacks. People will often notice how fresh you are and are more likely to offer better prices... including for the things they might not really want to do. In addition, an alert Dovahkiin will find that their knack for crawling unheard and blending with the shadows is just that little bit better. Of course, these effects only last eight hours, so look for beds around Skyrim to keep at your peak.

Werewolves can also now gain the benefits of sleep, via a perk in the werewolf perk tree once Dawnguard is installed.

Your home is your stronghold, a safe haven. All the worries of being the Dragonborn, like dragons, bandits, your morgatage, and that irritating civil war will be put of your mind when you rest at your house... and, of course, you can then put that clear head to greater use. Enchanting, tempering, and alchemy will all improved for two hours after you sleep in a house that you own. Don\'t worry, you\'ll be notified when this effect fades, so you don\'t accidentally foul up the enchantment on your favourite piece of armor.

This is my first mod, so if you can spare the time to leave detailed feedback, please do.

Full Effect List - Rested, Well Rested, Lover\'s Comfort

Skill experience: +5%, +10%, +15% - as in Skynilla
Health regen over time: +20%, +40%, +60%
Spell Cost: -5%, -10%, -15%
Power Attack Cost: -10%, -20%, -30%
Increased Encumbrance: +15%, +30%, +50%
Sneak buff: +5%, +10%, +15% to stat (should only affect detection)
Buy Prices: -3%, -6%, -10%
Sell Prices: +3%, +6%, +10%
Bribes: -5%, -10%, -15%

If you prefer, you can check out the mod in the Steam workshop [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=9056]here[/url] - however, it does not have the Dawnguard werewolf restedness perk just yet.
author: Darth Vella

files.name: Better Sleep 1_1
files.changelogHtml:
Non-XP Bonuses may be recieved while under the influence of the Lover\'s Stone.
Attempted fix for Skynilla marriage bug which renders players unable to recieve Lover\'s Comfort without first moving into their spouse\'s home.

files.name: Better Sleep 1_1a
files.changelogHtml: Removed annoying debug messages I activated trying to fix the marriage bug (sorry)

files.name: Better Sleep 2_0
files.changelogHtml:
Added in missing script files. 1.1 marriage bugfix should now apply.
You may now be Well Rested instead of Rested if you keep up your sleep.
Added two loading screens related to the above change.

files.name: Better Sleep 3_0
files.changelogHtml:
Added dependancy on the Dawnguard DLC.
Added a perk in the werewolf skill tree to allow werewolves to gain the benefits of sleep.
Added a loading screen related to this change.
Adjusted the number of werewolf perk points that can be gained to allow for the added perk.

files.name: Better Sleep Dawnguard - Compatibility
files.changelogHtml: Added compatibility version for Werewolf Perks Expanded by MichaelDusk

files.name: Vanilla 4_0
files.changelogHtml:
Attempted to balance spell cost reduction to account for the fact that spell cost reduction is easily stackable. New values are reductions of 5, 10, and 15%.
Added a new effect that is earned when you sleep in a player home. Safe Haven increases the effectiveness of alchemy, enchanting, and tempering by 10% each for two hours.
Added a loading screen related to this change.
